content.description: Jam through the initial overhang on awkward fists. Stem the wide section into progressively easier terrain, leaving the train-track cracks behind. Instead of slogging up the rest of the deteriorating system, finish with some contrived yet fun Sportz Action up and right past two lead bolts.Rappel from two-bolt chain anchor.
content.protection: Double set cams to 4" + one each 5-6" cams + two lead boltsTwo-bolt chain anchor
content.location: Train-track cracks in the first right-facing corner downhill of Tower Station's namesake tower.

content.description: Surprised this line was open! Climbs mostly great rock to the pointed summit just right of the areas namesake tower. Starting moves are a good warm-up but the angle steepens quickly and keeps coming until you pull the summit point. Save your power because you will need it on the steepening huecos; an enduro classic!
content.location: Just right of the areas namesake tower.

content.description:
A fun mini multipitch adventure. Shares the same intro pitch as Thing One. 

 Pitch 1, 5.9 Start up blocky terrain to a good stance below an obvious lieback crack. There can sometimes be a bush here if it hasn’t been climbed in a while. Follow the trickier-than-it-looks lieback to its end, pulling onto a nice comfy, shaded ledge and a bolted belay.

 Pitch 2, 5.10- Climb up and left off the belay. Instead of following the bolt line straight up the concave corner, make some tricky moves to clip a bolt out right. Continue through a few more tricky moves through great rock eventually leading to some huecos. Move up and to the right through more huescos to the arête and good holds. Follow the arête back left until it is possible to pull up onto the face above. Climb past a few more bolts to a bolted anchor with chains and carabiners.

A fun mini multipitch adventure. Shares the same intro pitch as Thing Two.

 Pitch 1, 5.9 Start up blocky terrain to a good stance below an obvious lieback crack. There can sometimes be a bush here if it hasn’t been climbed in a while. Follow the trickier-than-it-looks lieback to its end, pulling onto a nice comfy, shaded ledge and a bolted belay.

 Pitch 2, 5.10 Climb up and left from the belay and up into short crux through a steep-ish section. After the crux, enjoy the fun techy climbing up the concave corner. Bolted anchor with chains and carabiners.
content.location: 60ft or so uphill from the tower. Starts in a small alcove below a large juniper on the ledge above.

content.description: Right of Dad (Tower of Power) and goes at 10+ if you sneak left 25 ft below the rim (bolts provided). Rap/belay from Tower of Power chains. OR...head straight up steep hueco'd face to chains at 11+. Shares first bolt with ToP, then traverses right on slightly spicy (PG) bolts.
content.location: Tower Station Area; Upper Middle Elden

content.description: Climb good holds into a bulge crux at the 2nd bolt, then follow bolts straight up, more or less. Move right onto a nice rail, but then escape the rail straight up a scooped face past a couple more bolts to the anchor.
content.location: Above the detached tower, on the same formation as Lugano Way, about 25 feet to the left of LW. Has a steep little start leading to a featured, slabby panel.

content.description: Follow a beeline up a nice steep fingercrack and then into a beautiful zigzagging crack adorned with jugs inside and out. Continue up the grippy, featured corner to a ledge. Then climb up the super easy slab past a couple more bolts to the next ledge and the anchor. Pretty fun.
content.location: Hike up past the detached pillar to the next prominent wall along the trail with an obvious, attractive, juggy looking, zig zagging crack on it's right side. Lugotit! Get on it!

content.description: Starts up the face of a detached block, and transfers onto the wall at an attractive featured arete. Some nice pulls past a few bolts to a ledge and an anchor. You'll wish this warm up was 10 bears long...so toprope it once also.
content.location: A short distance above the Godfather pillar, look for a short line of bolts with orange colored hangers starting up a slabby, detached block along the trail. Between the Godfather and the Tower Station area.

climbs.name: Daily Driver
climbs.fa: Derek & Giselle Field (2020) --- ground-up in the rain

content.description: Boulder past two bolts to gain the thin crack. Follow it left on good locks and jams, clip a bolt on the right side, and pull the crux layback. Jam the remainder of the crack to the two-bolt chain anchor.
content.protection: Double set cams to 1", single set cams 1.25-3", one micro cam (e.g. purple mastercam)3 lead boltsTwo-bolt chain anchor
content.location: Boxy thin crack about 30 feet right of Gummy Bear.

content.description: The next collection of routes uphill from The Godfather Area. Named for the spindly tower separated from the cliff and a favorite local beer. At the moment the majority of the climbs are just uphill from the tower, but the first climb you will run into is Gummy Bear. Gummy Bear is about 100ft below the tower and is identified by red hangers. A good amount of new route potential still exists in this area.
